channel.title: I need design ideas!
channel.description:
I'm designing a website for myself to for eCommerce, my portfolio, blog/forum. I need help designing my front page (I can design everything else to match it).
I've looked online for "best looking websites", looking at templates etc., however I just cannot get a good design in my head. I'm not looking to make a website using that crappy parallax thing.
Could you guys help me design something? :)
I'm going to make a PSD before I make the actual site.
Everything I look at just doesn't appeal to me, I mean I might like a background on one website however hate the rest of it. So I'm looking to mix and match ideas that I might see on other sites or make something based around it.
Once I get started I'll post updates when I start designing it.

item.title: I need design ideas!
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

A lot of the design habits and techniques I learned from can be found by just looking at designs from http://www.themeforest.net.
Also, parallax can be a wonderful friend if you use it right.

Read full topic

item.title: I need design ideas!
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:5, topic:543832”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=662712.msg4429267#msg4429267 date=1402426923]
Remember a lot of the time less is more, I always stuck to simple sites and people tended to like them.
[/quote]
Made enough minimalistic sites. Not what I’m looking for.

Edit: https://disneyworld.disney.go.com/new-fantasyland/

I actually think the smoke around the “New fantasy land” ribbon looks awesome lol - I think I know how to recreate it using html5, so I might throw in something similar ;o

I’m going to take ideas from flash websites mainly, since they actually have good designs and content that I can use html5 to remake.[/quote]

Make a sick splash page to top everything off. That smoke is cool, but I’m not a fan of the purple. A black background with grey/light blue smoke like that would look cool.

The possibilities for design are endless. <-- Website developer problems.

Read full topic

item.title: I need design ideas!
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Ruby:

Remember a lot of the time less is more, I always stuck to simple sites and people tended to like them.

Made enough minimalistic sites. Not what I’m looking for.

Edit: https://disneyworld.disney.go.com/new-fantasyland/

I actually think the smoke around the “New fantasy land” ribbon looks awesome lol - I think I know how to recreate it using html5, so I might throw in something similar ;o

I’m going to take ideas from flash websites mainly, since they actually have good designs and content that I can use html5 to remake.

Read full topic

item.title: I need design ideas!
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:3, topic:543832”][quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=662712.msg4429242#msg4429242 date=1402420604]
I like to use http://www.free-css.com/ for inspiration.

I was looking at this one, looks nice. http://www.free-css.com/free-css-templates/page156/widecommerce#shout

What other things are you looking for? Columns? Sidebars? A slideshow? etc.
[/quote]
Anything that looks good. If having a side bar looks good I’ll add it lol

Those websites on the links are too plain for my liking.[/quote]

Remember a lot of the time less is more, I always stuck to simple sites and people tended to like them.

Read full topic
